settings.question: What is the difference between the Mila and the Zali Style?
settings.answer:
Our Mila style is made specifically for bodies that have a waist that is similar to their hips, or for those who need a little extra room around their mid-section without adding extra bagginess to their legs. The body shapes we associate our Mila pant with are commonly referred to as Apple, Rectangle, Inverted Triangle, Ruler, or Rectangle body shapes.

Our Zali style is made for bodies that tend to have a waist that is well defined and is significantly smaller than their hips. The Zali pant is associated with body shapes that are commonly labelled as Hourglass, Triangle or Pear, featuring larger bottoms, hips, and thighs.

If you feel unsure about which body shape you may have, or which style of pant/bib you might need, you can use our Body Shape Quiz or get in touch with us.

settings.question: What leg length do you recommend for me?
settings.answer:
Our leg lengths can been separated into three different groups of heights.

  • We recommend our Short Leg Length for those who are 5'2" or shorter.
  • We recommend our Regular Leg Length for those who sit between 5'3" and 5'8".
  • We recommend our Tall Leg Length for those who are 5'9" or above.

settings.question: Does your clothing run small or large?
settings.answer:
All clothing has made to be true to size. Our measurements are based on thousands of responses to the sizing survey we conducted in our initial research phase from women around the world in the snow community. We have found that our range can even run a little large due to the adjustability features.

While we understand buying online can be daunting and the normal response is to size up, we highly encourage you to size down if your measurements are between sizes. All measurements on our size charts should be matched to those of your body. The garments naturally will be a little larger than those measurements on the size chart due to this.

Please note: if you enjoy wearing your snow bib with hoodies or jackets underneath them for spring snow conditions, we do recommend you consider sizing up.

settings.question: Does your clothing have stretch?
settings.answer:
So. Much.

All our outerwear is made with a 4-way stretch that moves in any and every direction for ultimate comfort. This also means if you prefer a firmer/tighter fit, you can easily size down to get a 'slim fit'.

All lining is also made with stretch fabrics, and our waist bands boast two side panels made with a durable heat-activated elastic. This means they will stretch and mold to your body shape as they warm up from your body heat.

settings.question: How do I use the size charts?
settings.answer:
The size charts shown for each product show measurements for you to compare to your own body measurements. This means you do not need to add any additional 'buffer' to measurements to ensure your item will fit.

Our garments are naturally a little bigger than the measurements on the size chart, and take into consideration wearing base layers. It's because of this reason that we recommend sizing down if you find yourself between sizes.

You may also find your sizing with us is smaller than other brands, and this is due to the gross mis-sizing that is occurs with other brands. Your outerwear size with us should be close to the clothing you wear day to day.
